summary: This document is a chain of emails between the FBI's Criminal Investigative Division (CID) and the UK's National Crime Agency (NCA) regarding the sharing of intelligence related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The NCA provides financial intelligence on Epstein's former pilot and seeks clarification on an internal investigation into an individual named IVEAGH. The correspondence highlights international law enforcement cooperation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the FBI/DOJ enquiry for which the UK's National Crime Agency is sharing intelligence.

events.title: FBI/NCA Meeting
events.description: A meeting occurred last January between the FBI and the UK's National Crime Agency regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: NCA Inquiry on IVEAGH and Financial Intel
events.description: The NCA contacts the FBI to ask if an internal NSPCC investigation into an individual named IVEAGH would affect the FBI's probe, and offers financial intelligence on Epstein's former pilot.

locations: British Embassy, 3100 Massachusetts Avenue NW, Washington, DC 20008
keyFacts: The UK's National Crime Agency (NCA) was actively sharing intelligence with the FBI regarding the Jeffrey Epstein investigation in 2020.
The NCA possessed and offered to share financial intelligence related to Jeffrey Epstein's former pilot, held in a US bank account.
The NCA sought the FBI's view on whether an internal NSPCC investigation into an individual referred to as 'IVEAGH' would adversely affect the FBI's Epstein investigation.
The correspondence demonstrates ongoing international law enforcement cooperation and information sharing via channels like FinCEN (Financial Crimes Enforcement Network).
Multiple FBI personnel from the Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit and the Criminal Investigative Division were involved in receiving and coordinating this intelligence.
